item.title: [PI] Quest system 19 errors help A.S.A.P[PI]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“mr pker01, post:17, topic:394218”][code]
characterfile.newLine();
^
src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:263: class, interface, or enum expected

                    characterfile.write("character-posy = ", 0, 17);
                    ^

src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:264: class, interface, or enum expected

.toString(p.absY).length());
^

Integer.toString(p.playerRights).length());
^

                    ^

unt), 0, Integer.toString(p.crystalBowArrowCount).length());
^

nteger.toString(p.skullTimer).length());

] + “\t” + p.voidStatus[2] + “\t” + p.voidStatus[3] + “\t” + p.voidStatus[4];

100 errors
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

THERE[/quote]

You also need to post the errors at the very top. I’m not sure if there’s a “rollback” feature that does this in the command prompt.

Ah yes, it seems I made an error. You didn’t have to remove the } after the if block. You just needed to add a break before it.

Do that and you should be set.

item.title: [PI] Quest system 19 errors help A.S.A.P[PI]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“mr pker01, post:9, topic:394218”]Okay, i removed “if” and i got 21 more errors …

[code]src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:188: ‘else’ without ‘if’
else (token.equals(“questPoints”)) {
^
src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:188: not a statement
else (token.equals(“questPoints”)) {
^
src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:188: ‘;’ expected
else (token.equals(“questPoints”)) {
^
src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:476: expected
characterfile.write("[QUEST]", 0, 7);
^
src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:476: illegal start of type
characterfile.write("[QUEST]", 0, 7);
^
src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:476: illegal start of type
characterfile.write("[QUEST]", 0, 7);
^
src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:476: illegal start of type
characterfile.write("[QUEST]", 0, 7);
^
src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:477: expected
characterfile.newLine();
^
src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:478: expected
characterfile.write("questPoints = ", 0, 14);
^
src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:478: illegal start of type
characterfile.write("questPoints = ", 0, 14);
^
src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:478: illegal start of type
characterfile.write("questPoints = ", 0, 14);
^
src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:478: illegal start of type
characterfile.write("questPoints = ", 0, 14);
^
src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:479: expected
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.questPoints), 0,
Integer.toString(p.questPoints).length());
^
src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:479: expected
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.questPoints), 0,
Integer.toString(p.questPoints).length());
^
src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:479: ‘;’ expected
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.questPoints), 0,
Integer.toString(p.questPoints).length());
^
src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:479: illegal start of type
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.questPoints), 0,
Integer.toString(p.questPoints).length());
^
src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:479: ‘;’ expected
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.questPoints), 0,
Integer.toString(p.questPoints).length());
^
src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:479: expected
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.questPoints), 0,
Integer.toString(p.questPoints).length());

            ^

src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:479: expected
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.questPoints), 0,
Integer.toString(p.questPoints).length());

                          ^

src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:479: ‘;’ expected
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.questPoints), 0,
Integer.toString(p.questPoints).length());

                           ^

src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:480: expected
characterfile.newLine();
^
21 errors
Press any key to continue . . .[/code][/quote]

No. The error said that there was an else without an if. You can’t have an else without an if.

Remove the else.

You will have more errors, because there’s no “break” for the case. Instead it seems as though you’ve added another } which is not the same as a break.

Replace the } following the if block with a break.

Read full topic
